pages.title: Trellix ePO Self-Signed SSL Certificate
pages.content: Complete Step-by-Step Guide | Most Secure & Recommended Method

pages.title: Contents
pages.content: 1. Overview & Prerequisites; 2. OpenSSL Installation & Setup; 3. Certificate Generation Process; 4. ePO Deployment & Verification; 5. Troubleshooting & Best Practices

pages.title: 01: Overview & Prerequisites
pages.content: Understanding self-signed certificates and preparing your environment

pages.title: Why Self-Signed Certificates?
pages.content: This page explains the rationale behind using self-signed SSL certificates for Trellix ePO, including ideal use cases for internal networks and lab environments, and the security features that make this method robust and recommended.

pages.title: Prerequisites & Requirements
pages.content: This page presents the complete list of hardware, software, and access requirements needed before starting the certificate generation process, organized in a clear table format for easy reference.

pages.title: 02: OpenSSL Installation & Setup
pages.content: Installing OpenSSL and creating the working environment

pages.title: Step 1: Download and Install OpenSSL
pages.content: This page provides detailed instructions for downloading the correct OpenSSL version, installation steps with specific options, and explains why the Light version is sufficient for certificate creation tasks.

pages.title: Step 2: Create Folder Structure
pages.content: This page explains the purpose of each folder in the SSL directory structure and provides the exact commands to create the organized file system for certificate management.

pages.title: Step 3: Create OpenSSL Configuration File
pages.content: This page presents the complete OpenSSL configuration file with Subject Alternative Name (SAN) support, explains each field's purpose, and provides guidance on customizing values for your specific environment.

pages.title: 03: Certificate Generation Process
pages.content: Generating secure keys and certificates with OpenSSL

pages.title: Step 4: Generate Password-Protected Private Key
pages.content: This page details the command for creating a secure 2048-bit RSA private key with Triple DES encryption, explains each parameter, and emphasizes the importance of remembering the passphrase.

pages.title: Step 5: Create Self-Signed Certificate with SAN
pages.content: This page walks through generating the self-signed certificate using the configuration file, explains the command parameters including validity period and key usage, and shows the expected output.

pages.title: Step 6: Convert to RSA Traditional Format
pages.content: This page explains the critical conversion step from PKCS#8 to traditional RSA format required by ePO, provides the conversion command, and clarifies why this step is necessary for compatibility.

pages.title: Step 7: Verify Certificate (Optional but Recommended)
pages.content: This page presents the verification command and shows what to look for in the output, including confirming the Subject Alternative Name, organization details, and validity period before proceeding to deployment.

pages.title: 04: ePO Deployment & Verification
pages.content: Uploading certificates and completing the installation

pages.title: Step 8: Upload Certificate to ePO
pages.content: This page provides step-by-step navigation instructions for the ePO console, shows exactly which files to upload in each field, and explains why the private key password field should be left empty.

pages.title: Step 9: Restart ePO Server
pages.content: This page presents three different methods for restarting the ePO Application Server service, including command-line and GUI options, and explains why the restart is essential for the new certificate to take effect.

pages.title: Step 10: Import Certificate to Browser
pages.content: This page details the process of importing the certificate to the Windows Trusted Root Certification Authorities store to eliminate browser security warnings, with step-by-step instructions for the certificate import wizard.

pages.title: Summary of Files Created
pages.content: This page presents a comprehensive table summarizing all four files created during the process, their locations, and their specific purposes in the certificate infrastructure for easy reference and backup planning.

pages.title: 05: Troubleshooting & Best Practices
pages.content: Common issues, solutions, and security recommendations

pages.title: Troubleshooting Common Errors
pages.content: This page addresses the most frequently encountered errors including invalid private key format, missing SAN errors, persistent browser warnings, and service restart issues, with specific causes and solutions for each.

pages.title: Quick Reference Commands
pages.content: This page provides a complete consolidated list of all commands used throughout the process, organized by step, for quick copy-paste reference during actual certificate deployment.

pages.title: Security Best Practices
pages.content: This page outlines six critical security recommendations for maintaining certificate infrastructure integrity, including key protection, strong passphrases, access restrictions, renewal planning, backups, and production environment considerations.

pages.title: Certificate Deployment Complete
pages.content: Your Trellix ePO server is now secured with a self-signed SSL certificate. Remember to monitor certificate expiration and renew before the 365-day validity period ends.
